## this is the initial look at the zebrafish quantSeq data
## just analysis based on the experssion to look at correlation between replicates + clustering and PCA analysis.

```{r readinInDataAndColumnFiles}
sampleInfoPath = read.delim("/Volumes/groups-3//ameres/Pooja/Projects/zebrafishAnnotation/slamSeq/dataDescription.txt",header = F)
library(DESeq2)

filePaths = file.path("/Volumes/groups-3/ameres/Pooja/Projects/zebrafishAnnotation/slamSeq/counts/",sampleInfoPath$V1)

data_counts = lapply(filePaths,function(x) read.delim(x,stringsAsFactors = F,sep="\t",header = T))


onlyCounts = lapply(data_counts,function(x) x$ReadCount)
onlyCounts = do.call(cbind,onlyCounts)
library(GGally)

colnames(onlyCounts) = sampleInfoPath$V4
onlyCounts = onlyCounts[-which(rowSums(onlyCounts)<5),]
onlyCounts_cor = cor(onlyCounts)
pdf("/Volumes/groups-3/ameres/Pooja/Projects/zebrafishAnnotation/plots/initialAnalysis/correlationPlots.pdf")
corrplot::corrplot((onlyCounts_cor),type = "lower")
dev.off()

library(fpc)
library(ggplot2)
kclust=kmeans(t(onlyCounts),centers=6)
kclust$cluster <- as.factor(kclust$cluster)
d=dist(t(onlyCounts), method = "euclidean") 
fit=cmdscale(d,eig=TRUE, k=6) # k is the number of dim


clus= (kmeans(x = t(onlyCounts),centers = 6))

pdf("/Volumes/groups-3/ameres/Pooja/Projects/zebrafishAnnotation/plots/initialAnalysis/PCS.pdf")
p = ggplot(data.frame(t(onlyCounts)), aes(fit$points[,1], fit$points[,2], color =  factor(kclust$cluster),label=rownames(fit$points))) + xlab("PC1") + ylab("PC2")
p <- p + theme(axis.title.y = element_text(size = rel(1.5), angle = 90))
p <- p + theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = rel(1.5), angle = 00))
p= p + theme(axis.text=element_text(size=16,angle=90),axis.title=element_text(size=20,face="bold")) + geom_point(size=4)
p= p + theme(legend.text = element_text(size = 14, colour = "black"))
p= p + theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 18, colour = "black"))
p= p  + theme(legend.key.size = unit(1.5,"cm"))+geom_label(aes(fit$points[,1],fit$points[,2],rownames(fit$points))) 
p
dev.off()


a  = DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(onlyCounts,colData = sampleInfoPath,design = ~V5 )
 rld = rlog(a,blind = T)
 
 plotPCA(rld)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r slamSeq, echo=FALSE}
sampleInfoPath = read.delim("/Volumes/groups-3//ameres/Pooja/Projects/zebrafishAnnotation/slamSeq/dataDescription.txt",header = F)
sampleInfoPath = sampleInfoPath[1:13,]
sampleInfoPath = sampleInfoPath[-c(7,8),]
library(DESeq2)

filePaths = file.path("/Volumes/groups-3/ameres/Pooja/Projects/zebrafishAnnotation/slamSeq/counts/",sampleInfoPath$V1)

data_counts = lapply(filePaths,function(x) read.table(x,stringsAsFactors = F,sep="\t",header = T))
tCounts = lapply(data_counts,function(x) x$ConversionRate)
tCounts = do.call(cbind,tCounts)
cpm = lapply(data_counts,function(x) x$ReadsCPM)
cpm = do.call(cbind,cpm)
greaterThan5 = which(apply(cpm,1,max)>10)
tCounts = tCounts[greaterThan5,]
colnames(tCounts) = sampleInfoPath$V4
tCounts_injection = tCounts[,grep("injection",colnames(tCounts))]

library(cluster)
a = (pam(tCounts_injection,k=3))







```
